title: 5 reasons why finding rental properties in Bangalore is next to impossible
text:
5 reasons why finding rental properties in Bangalore is next to impossible 5 reasons why finding rental properties in Bangalore is next to impossible Like this story, share it with millions of investors on M3 5 reasons why finding rental properties in Bangalore is next to impossible 5 reasons why finding rental properties in Bangalore is next to impossible Post your opinion here 
T he silicon valley of India has always attracted a fair pool of floating population and with most of them considering renting out spaces rather than buying one, the demand for properties for rent have gone up. But finding a place to stay on rent is becoming quite difficult here. We find out why migrants are finding it difficult to locate apartments for rent in Bangalore. 
Dealing with brokers and landlords 
If identifying a property was not a tough task in itself, trusting and dealing with real estate brokers has made it worse. Trusting the broker and then dealing with the home owner has put off a number of potential tenants. Landlords usually hesitate when it comes to renting out their property to bachelors due to their lifestyle. Home owners also think they will end up with damaged property as they think single men will not be able to maintain their property. 
High rentals 
With property prices soaring landlords are renting properties because of the profitability factor. The robust rental returns have created a good opportunity for many second time home buyers and local investors. The city today has been cited to be one of the most expensive cities for rental properties and landlords today are marking up rentals by five times due to the constant demand. 
Unaffordable security deposits 
If high rents were not enough, landlords today are requesting a lump sum amount as deposits. A landlord can easily ask for a deposit which falls anywhere between INR 1 lakh to INR 16 lakhs depending on how well the homes have been furnished. Since the tenant is forced to produce the bulk amount within a limited time period, most of the tenants give up on hunting for rental spaces. 
Compromised privacy 
Another common issue faced by the tenants here is lack of privacy. Home owners are at free will to invade the tenantsâ€™ privacy thus forcing tenants to retaliate or move away from the property. If tenants are bachelors then landlords draw up a curfew that bans them from drinking, partying or having many friends over. 
Eviction 
Sudden eviction has always been a major concern for tenants. The delay in return of security deposits and introduction of sudden clauses in the rental agreements are also some of the problems faced by tenants. Landlords asking tenants to leave the property immediately due to personal reasons too has created a havoc. 
Nidhi C Thacker for IndiaProperty.com
